docs.title: What is and How to generate a HAR File?
docs.description: A HAR (HTTP Archive) file is a log of all network requests made by a web page in your web browser. It includes details about each request, such as the URL, response headers, request headers, and timings. Generating a HAR file is a useful troubleshooting tool because it provides a comprehensive snapshot of a web page's network activity, allowing for precise issue identification.

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.description: Your data will be securely hosted on Atlassian's infrastructure known as Forge. The Forge platform is designed to ensure high levels of security and compliance with industry standards. As the app vendor, we do not have access to any of the data stored on this platform. This means that all your data remains private and inaccessible to us. Additionally, Atlassian implements robust security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, ensuring its confidentiality and integrity. Should you have any concerns or require further information about data storage and security, please refer to Atlassian's own privacy policies and security documentation.

docs.title: ▮ Smart Variables
docs.description: The Smart Variables empowers your Confluence pages with rich, dynamic content. By inserting variables like {{space.status}} or {{page.author.email}}, you can effortlessly pull live data about your Confluence spaces and pages, turning static pages into powerful, interactive content hubs.

docs.title: Variable Reference Guide
docs.description: Smart variables are dynamic variables that can make your content more flexible. Each smart variable is constructed using a specific syntax called dot notation inside double mustache brackets. It's written as a hierarchy, starting with a top-level object and followed by properties of that object, {{object.property.subProperty}}. Notice that multiword properties use camelCase capitalization.
